result.execSummary:
The defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber for work, school and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge and all other costs and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  If in school, defendant may work part time.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.  Defendant does not have to pay DNA surcharge if previously.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms; and that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

No illegal drugs.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Danavan R., Larry J. and Lontonio S.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed neccessary by the department.  Random urine screens. Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alim Hasan Muhammad

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 1/5/2015.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction to state jail term of 60 days in the House of Correction received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
DOC notification of possible excessive sentence.

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 months in the House of Correction with Huber for work, school and treatment, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.
*Absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Danavan R., Larry J. and Lontonio S.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment., if in school defendant may work part-time
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.  Defendant does not have to pay DNA surcharge if paid previously.
Defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other costs and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

Filed,
-Notice of Right  to Seek Postconviction Relief.
-signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Case transferred forthwith to Br. 26, Judge Pocan for sentencing.

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 12/8/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defendant wishes to resolve the case.  Attorney Levine is in trial before Judge Wagner.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 10/15/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 634
cf

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense counsel requests time to talk with ADA Loebel.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion in limine, received and filed.  aw
Defendant's proposed jury instructions received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing proceed.  Sequestration ordered.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Christopher Conway.  Exhibits 1, 2, & 3 offered.  Exhibits 2 and 3, received.  State rests, subject to rebuttal.
Court held colloquy wi   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.th defendant on his right to testify and right not to testify.  Defense rests.  Evidentiary phase is complete.  Closing arguments made.  Court denies defendant's motion to suppress.  Defense requests trial date.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9/3/2014 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 10/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's response to the defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Certification of transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING proceedings commencing APRIL 9, 2014, received and filed. (16 Pages.)  jm
Copy of transcript forwarded to MICHAEL LEVINE, 111 E. WISCONSIN AVE., #1710, MILWAUKEE, WI  53202.

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a dispositive motion.  State to respond by 8/8/2014.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 8/22/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Motion to suppress evidence and statements, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G Levine.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/2/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G Levine.  Karen A Loebel appeared for Antonella Aleman for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Kevin Shomin for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Conway-MPD Officer.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #12CM3544 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-09-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Alim Hasan Muhammad not in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-17-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
